- Work with our Tableau Developer and Project Manager to translate wireframes into requirements and Jira-type tasks
- Establish design guidelines, colour schemes, and placement of filters/charts
- Ideally leverage a Figma-Tableau extension to load a Tableau skeleton onto Figma, wireframe and design, then send Tableau file back to Tableau developer so that Figma-established design standards are flowed through

Key Skills:
- Experience at a consulting firm or similar role where you've had to pitch narratives, distilled complex data into crisp, impactful visuals
- UI/UX or Product Design: Proficient in Figma, with strong grasp of layout design, colour theory, and user flows.
- Comfort with Tableau, enough to collaborate with existing Tableau leadership on the team
- Bonus: experience with real estate property metrics

- Likely 10~15 hours initially, with opportunity for continued participation

Each piece of content follows a structured pipeline:

Content ID (unique for each piece)

Performance Feedback: Notes from the Social Media team

Content IDs used

The system updates the Content Inventory with posting history.

The no-code expert must recommend and implement tools that:
Support Kanban-based workflows for each phase
Integrate with Slack for automation & notifications
Link to Google Drive for content access
Track posting history and feedback in a centralized inventory

job_description:
Upwork Job Posting: High-Level System Architecture Diagram for AI-Native Government

Job Title:

🚀 Expert in AI System Architecture & Technical Diagramming (Figma, Lucidchart, Miro, draw.io)

Job Description:

We are seeking an experienced AI systems architect and technical diagramming expert to create a high-level system architecture diagram for an AI-Native Government Framework. The goal is to represent how AI-driven decision-making, federated governance, security, and AI compute infrastructure interact within a public sector AI ecosystem.

The final deliverable should be an editable, collaborative, and detailed system architecture diagram, enabling government stakeholders to visualize AI workflows, security enforcement, and AI orchestration layers.

Key Responsibilities:

✅ Translate complex AI architecture into a clear, structured visual representation.
✅ Use collaborative design tools (Figma, Lucidchart, Miro, draw.io) for easy team feedback & revisions.
✅ Ensure the diagram is editable, interactive, and allows for iterative updates.
✅ Apply industry best practices in AI governance, security, and decision orchestration.
✅ Work closely with us to refine the design for clarity, accuracy, and completeness.


---

🌍 Preferred Tools for Delivery:

You must deliver the final diagram in one of the following tools, ensuring that team members can collaborate, comment, and revise as needed:
✅ Figma (Preferred – allows real-time collaboration & structured UI)
✅ Lucidchart (Ideal for structured technical diagrams & flowcharts)
✅ Miro (Best for brainstorming & big-picture design)
✅ draw.io (diagrams.net) (Lightweight, integrates with Google Drive)

📌 Final deliverable must be editable and shareable for ongoing team collaboration.


---

🔹 Diagram Structure & Layered Approach

The diagram should be structured as a hierarchical AI governance framework, organized into four main layers:

1️⃣ User Interaction Layer (Top Layer)

📍 Represents citizens, agencies, and data providers interacting with AI services.

✅ Elements:

Citizens → Request AI-driven government services.

Government Agencies → Manage AI-driven decision-making.

Data Providers → Supply external data via Data Mesh (Decentralized Governance).


📡 Connections:

Citizens → Government Agencies

Government Agencies ↔ Data Providers (via Data Mesh)



---

2️⃣ AI Orchestration & Decision-Making Layer

📍 The core AI processing layer, handling secure, explainable AI decision-making.

✅ Elements:

Prompt Security (IBM Guardrails) – Prevents adversarial AI input.

Multi-Model Competitive Reasoning (MMCR) – AI decisions validated across multiple models.

AI Model Farm – Mix of open-source (Llama 3, Falcon, etc.) & closed-source AI models (if hybrid).

vAI Logging (Verifiable AI Logging) – Ensures AI decision transparency & auditing.

AI Explainability Dashboards – Provides human oversight of AI-generated recommendations.

Sparse Activation & PEFT (Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning) – Optimizes AI execution dynamically.


📡 Connections:

Government Agencies → Prompt Security

Prompt Security → MMCR

MMCR → AI Model Farm (Llama 3, Mixtral-8x22B, Falcon, etc.)

AI Model Farm → vAI Logging → AI Explainability Dashboards

MMCR → Final AI-powered decision → Government Agencies



---

3️⃣ Data Governance & Security Layer

📍 Ensures secure AI usage, compliance, and decentralized AI governance.

✅ Elements:

Data Mesh (Decentralized Governance) – Prevents excessive centralization.

Federated AI Access Control (FAAC) – Role-based AI access & security enforcement.

Dedicated Key Management System (KMS) – Cryptographic trust & encryption management.

Confidential AI Enclaves (Intel SGX, AMD SEV) – Secure processing of sensitive AI workloads.

Selective FHE (Fully Homomorphic Encryption) – Enables encrypted AI model execution.


📡 Connections:

Data Providers → Data Mesh

Data Mesh → FAAC → AI Orchestration Layer

Data Mesh → Confidential AI Enclaves (for sensitive data)

Data Mesh → Selective FHE (for high-sensitivity data processing)



---

4️⃣ AI Compute Infrastructure Layer (Bottom Layer)

📍 Provides the physical AI processing backbone (inference, model training, orchestration).

✅ Elements:

DGX Pods / TPU Clusters – AI compute clusters for on-prem AI processing.

Kafka + Ray Serve – AI event processing framework.


📡 Connections:

DGX Pods / TPU Clusters → AI Model Farm

Kafka + Ray Serve → Multi-Model Competitive Reasoning (MMCR)

AI Explainability Dashboards → Connects to AI decisions for transparency



---

🔹 Design Considerations & Formatting Guidelines

✅ Data Mesh Representation:

Use multiple “Data Provider” nodes connected to a central “Data Mesh” component.


✅ AI Competitive Reasoning Representation:

Show parallel AI decision paths validating each AI response.

Highlight voting/consensus mechanisms preventing single-model bias.


✅ Security & Encryption Representation:

Label where FHE encryption & Confidential AI Enclaves are used.

Use icons for AI security features (guardrails, key management, etc.).


✅ Sparse Activation & PEFT Representation:

Add callout boxes near AI Model Farm explaining optimization techniques.


✅ Arrow & Flow Representation:

Solid arrows for data flow.

Dashed arrows for security, governance, and AI decision validation.


✅ Color Coding for Readability:

🔴 Security components (Guardrails, FAAC, Key Management).

🔵 AI Decision-Making (MMCR, AI Model Farm, Sparse Activation).

🟢 Governance & Explainability (Data Mesh, vAI Logging, Dashboards).

job_title: Development of Chrome extension - Analyzes screenshots using AI
job_description:
I am looking for a moderately skilled developer to create a Chrome extension which allows users to easily capture screenshots, to be sent to a GPT Vision API, and another powerful LLM with vision capabilities, to analyze and provide insightful advice based what it ""sees"" on the users screenshot.

Since GPT Vision is somewhat lacking in it's capabilities, there should be a secondary (or even third, if there is a noticeable improvement) AI image interpretation API which would validate what GPT Vision sees, or disputes it. This is why a third LLM would be good, so there should usually be 2 out of 3 of them that agree on things, which should increase the accuracy of the final output.

I would like an image returned to the user if they request it, which is the same as their screenshot, but with a certain area highlighted or circled so they know exactly where to look.  This way, the user can ask something like ""Where do I click in order to submit this form"" and it would send them back their same screenshot with the ""Submit"" button circled or highlighted.  Or ""Where is the part of this code which is giving me an error?"".

If the user sees an error in the AI suggestions, there should be an ability to submit the error noticed, along with the corresponding screenshot.  This information can be used later to further train the AI to better understand these same tasks in the future.  There should also be an ability to train the AI model further on the back end so that it can learn from new pictures (screenshots) and descriptions of them.

All conversations with the bot would be saved in the extension.  Specific conversations could be easily found using a search feature.  They would ideally be able to be organized and exported as well.

The project should be user-friendly and have seamless, low latency integration with GPT and any other APIs. The user will have the ability to send screenshots to the extension by just pressing one of the ""F"" keys while the extension is open/live.  Alternatively, they can hold the same (or other) ""F"" key while selecting a square on their screen with their mouse, in order to capture a smaller, more specific area for the app to analyze it better.

It should also have another layer of OCR integrated on top of what GPT ""sees"", to validate any text picked up in the picture.

The extension should have certain websites it will not allow such as streaming services, online courses, financial/banking sites, confidential corporate (or other sensitive) material.  As a secondary safety feature, the app should pre-process all screenshots locally first to ensure any private data doesn't leave their own computer.  This would also act as another failsafe measure to restrict access to these sites from the user, so that the program doesn't violate any restrictions.

If you have experience in Chrome extension development and working with AI technologies, I'd love to hear from you!

job_description:
MVP Technical Parameters – AI-Driven Sales System (Singapore Focus, 500 Calls/Day)
🚀 Goal: Fully automate cold calling operations using Vapi AI to handle 500 calls daily, converting cold leads into scheduled meetings with minimal human intervention.
________________________________________
1. System Architecture
Core Components
✅ Lead Database: Google Sheets (Stores business names, phone numbers, emails, call status, and scheduling details).
✅ AI Cold Calling: Vapi AI (Handles outbound calls, manages objections, and books meetings).
✅ Automation Layer: n8n (Connects all tools and automates workflow).
✅ Scheduling & Calendar Management: Google Calendar (Meetings are auto-booked when leads agree to a call).
✅ Singapore-Specific Setup: Adjustments for visibility restrictions (workaround for local call regulations).
✅ Email Follow-ups: Gmail (Automated meeting confirmations and follow-ups).
✅ Developer’s Responsibility: Ensuring seamless connectivity to minimize issues such as calls being blocked, flagged as spam, or delivery failures.
________________________________________
2. Workflow Overview (500 Calls/Day)
Step-by-Step Process
1️⃣ Lead Input & Targeting
•	Lead data (business name, phone, email) is manually or automatically added to Google Sheets.
•	Target businesses are based in Singapore.
2️⃣ Trigger AI Calls (500 Calls Daily)
•	n8n pulls 500 leads daily from Google Sheets and sends them to Vapi AI for calls.
•	Vapi AI follows pre-defined call scripts optimized for conversion.
3️⃣ Handling Scenarios in Vapi AI
•	If the lead is interested → AI books a meeting in Google Calendar.
•	If the lead has objections → AI follows a pre-programmed objection-handling script.
•	If the lead requests a callback → Vapi AI schedules a follow-up call.
•	If the lead does not answer → AI reschedules automatically for another attempt.
•	If the lead declines → Status is updated in Google Sheets, removing them from future attempts.
4️⃣ Meeting Scheduling & Confirmation
•	If a meeting is booked, n8n:
o	Updates Google Sheets (Status: ""Meeting Scheduled"").
o	Creates a Google Calendar event.
o	Sends a confirmation email via Gmail.
5️⃣ Post-Call Processing & Follow-Ups
•	Leads that do not answer are retried within 24 hours.
•	Leads who request more info are sent an automated follow-up email via Gmail.
•	Meeting confirmations are sent automatically to both parties.
________________________________________
3. Technical Parameters & API Integrations
Component	Technology	Purpose
Lead Storage	Google Sheets	Stores leads, call logs, status updates
AI Voice Agent	Vapi AI	AI-powered call execution, objection handling, scheduling
Automation	n8n	Connects Sheets, Vapi, Calendar for real-time updates
Scheduling	Google Calendar	Auto-books and tracks meetings
Follow-up Emails	Gmail	Sends automated confirmation & follow-ups
Logging & Tracking	Google Sheets	Updates lead status post-call
Anti-Spam Prevention	Developer Implementation	Minimizes call blocking & spam flags
________________________________________
4. Deployment Considerations
📌 Singapore-Specific Adjustments
🔹 Call Visibility: Many Singapore users have their numbers hidden from unknown calls. Vapi AI must optimize call retry logic for better reach.
🔹 Call Timing Optimization: Calls should be made during business hours (9 AM - 6 PM SG Time) to maximize answer rates.
🔹 Compliance & Local Regulations: Ensure Do Not Call (DNC) list compliance to avoid issues.
📌 AI Voice Agent Tuning (Vapi AI)
•	Call Script Optimization:
o	AI handles basic objections (e.g., “I’m busy,” “Not interested right now,” “Send me details”).
o	Closing strategy: AI secures the meeting before ending the call.
•	Call Volume Management:
o	Calls are spaced out to prevent spam detection.
o	AI retries unanswered calls at different times of the day.
•	Developer Responsibility for Spam Prevention:
o	Setting up rotating phone numbers to avoid getting flagged.
o	Implementing AI-driven call pacing to reduce high-frequency call flags.
o	Adjusting speech patterns in Vapi AI to prevent detection as a bot.
________________________________________
5. Success Metrics & Next Steps
📈 Key Metrics:
•	Call Success Rate: 35% of calls answered and completed.
•	Meeting Booking Rate: 4% of leads converted to meetings.
